cavalry in front, behind it the artillery, and behind that again the infantry. 
A space like a street was left between each two lines of troops. The three parts of that army were sharply distinguished: Kutiizov's fighting army (with the Pdvlograds on the right 
flank of the front); those recently arrived from Russia, both Guards and regiments of the line; and the Austrian troops. But they all stood in the same lines, under one command, and in a like order.
